intro: Nigellastrum flavum, commonly known as the golden star vine, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, star-shaped yellow flowers. The plant produces small, elliptical leaves that are opposite in arrangement. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded or semi-shaded areas. Nigellastrum flavum is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and flowers.
